Description: Coverage of Larry Ellison's strategy to challenge Amazon (AWS). Framed as a "second mover" correcting market inefficiencies.
Larry Ellison identified as a top donor to Marco Rubio. Contrasted with liberal Silicon Valley donors; viewed as "hawkish, pro-business."
Extensive coverage of Oracle lobbying against Amazon for the Pentagon cloud contract. Ellison framed as a whistleblower exposing the "Deep State" swamp.
Review criticizing David Ellison's film for "progressive pandering" and killing John Connor. A warning against "woke" storytelling.
Larry Ellison hosts Trump fundraiser. Described as "breaking the Silicon Valley Omerta" and showing immense courage.
Coverage of HQ move to Austin and Larry to Lanai. Celebrated as a victory for conservative governance and an indictment of California.
Euphoric review calling it an "unapologetic masterpiece of American exceptionalism." David Ellison praised for rejecting streaming to save theaters.
Larry Ellison contributes $1B to Musk's Twitter bid. Contextualized as the "silent partner" in the liberation of free speech.
Larry Ellison backs Tim Scott's Super PAC ($30M). Viewed as seeking a "sunny, supply-side" post-Trump conservatism.
Coverage of the "David vs. Goliath" deal to buy Paramount. Larry Ellison identified as the "wallet" making the restoration of legacy media possible.
Paramount deal closes. The "Redstone chaos" is replaced by "Ellison discipline." Speculation begins on "correcting" CBS News bias.
